feature1.explanation: Both texts use informal punctuation styles with hyphens, commas, and quotation marks. Text 1 uses more informal language and punctuation marks, while Text 2 is slightly more formal.

feature2.explanation: Both texts exhibit similar lexical choices with informal language and some jargon related to military terms. Text 1 shows more variation in word choice compared to Text 2.

feature3.explanation: Both texts have relatively similar sentence structures with shorter sentences and informal language. Text 1 is slightly more coherent and cohesive compared to Text 2.

feature4.explanation: Both texts maintain a similar tone and mood with informal expressions and a conversational style. Text 1 has a slightly more casual tone compared to Text 2.

feature5.explanation: Both texts lack spelling and typographical errors, indicating a similar level of attention to detail in writing.

overall.explanation: Considering the analysis of the five features, the overall confidence in the likelihood that the two texts were written by the same author is moderate. The texts exhibit similarities in punctuation style, lexical and grammatical features, sentence structure, text and discourse features, and spelling accuracy, albeit with some variations.
